levels.description: The problem is not described.
The problem is described briefly, but it is unclear what the system does or what functionality is expected.
The README clearly describes the problem, the systemâ€™s functionality, and what the project is expected to do.
No description of how the system was built or how AI tools were used.
The project describes how AI tools were used to build the system (e.g. coding assistants, prompts, workflows, AGENTS.md or similar guidance).
The project clearly documents AI-assisted system development and additionally describes how MCP was used (e.g. MCP server, tools, or workflow).
Technologies used in the project are not described or are unclear.
The main technologies are mentioned (e.g. frontend framework, backend framework, database), but without explaining their roles.
The project clearly describes the technologies used (frontend, backend, database, containerization, CI/CD) and explains how they fit into the system architecture.
No front-end or non-functional front-end.
A functional front-end exists, but structure is unclear or backend calls are scattered.
Front-end is functional and well-structured, with centralized backend communication.
Front-end is functional, well-structured, and includes tests covering core logic, with clear instructions on how to run them.
No OpenAPI specification.
OpenAPI specification exists but is incomplete or loosely aligned with front-end needs.
OpenAPI specification fully reflects front-end requirements and is used as the contract for backend development.
No back-end or back-end does not follow the API contract.
Back-end implements required endpoints but has limited structure or documentation.
Back-end is well-structured and follows the OpenAPI specifications.
Back-end is well-structured, follows the OpenAPI specifications, and includes tests covering core functionality, clearly documented.
No database or persistent storage.
Database is integrated, but configuration or usage is minimal or poorly documented.
Database layer is properly integrated, supports different environments (e.g. SQLite and Postgres), and is documented.
No containerization.
Dockerfiles exist, but running the full system requires manual steps.
The entire system runs via Docker or docker-compose with clear instructions.
No integration tests.
Integration tests exist but are limited or not clearly separated from unit tests.
Integration tests are clearly separated, cover key workflows (including database interactions), and are documented.
Application is not deployed.
Deployment steps are described, but no working deployment is shown.
Application is deployed to the cloud with a working URL or clear proof of deployment.
No CI/CD pipeline.
CI pipeline runs tests automatically.
CI/CD pipeline runs tests and deploys the application when tests pass.
Project cannot be run with the provided instructions.
Project can be run, but setup or run instructions are incomplete.
Clear instructions exist to set up, run, test, and deploy the system end-to-end.
